text:
C. Stage of labour 
Remember
/circle6 Vaginal examinations are rarely required during pregnancy.
/circle6  During labour, vaginal examination should not be attempted more than once every 
four hours (to avoid unnecessary infection). 
/circle6  Do not carry out a vaginal examination if the woman is bleeding at the time of 
labour or at any time during pregnancy. Manage this as a case of ‘vaginal bleeding 
in pregnancy’ [refer to Module 2].
